quote: A room without books is like a body without a soul.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies. The man who never reads lives only one.
author: George R.R. Martin

quote: You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Books are a uniquely portable magic.
author: Stephen King

quote: I find television very educational. Every time someone turns it on, I go into another room and read a book.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Reading is to the mind what exercise is to the body.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: There is no friend as loyal as a book.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: A book is a dream that you hold in your hand.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library.
author: Jorge Luis Borges

quote: The only thing you absolutely have to know is the location of the library.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking.
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: A great book should leave you with many experiences, and slightly exhausted at the end. You live several lives while reading.
author: William Styron

quote: The reading of all good books is like a conversation with the finest minds of past centuries.
author: René Descartes

quote: A book is a version of the world. If you do not like it, ignore it; or offer your own version in return.
author: Salman Rushdie

quote: There are many little ways to enlarge your world. Love of books is the best of all.
author: Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis

quote: I cannot live without books.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: A well-read woman is a dangerous creature.
author: Lisa Kleypas

quote: The books that the world calls immoral are books that show the world its own shame.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: There is no substitute for books in the life of a child.
author: May Ellen Chase

quote: Books are the plane, and the train, and the road. They are the destination, and the journey. They are home.
author: Anna Quindlen

quote: A book is like a garden carried in the pocket.
author: Chinese Proverb

quote: The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Books are mirrors: you only see in them what you already have inside you.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón

quote: Reading one book is like eating one potato chip.
author: Diane Duane

quote: A book is the only place in which you can examine a fragile thought without breaking it.
author: Edward P. Morgan

quote: I declare after all there is no enjoyment like reading! How much sooner one tires of anything than of a book!
author: Jane Austen

quote: A book is a dream you hold in your hands.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: The love of books is a love which requires neither justification, apology, nor defense.
author: J.A. Langford

quote: Books are the quietest and most constant of friends; they are the most accessible and wisest of counselors, and the most patient of teachers.
author: Charles W. Eliot

quote: A book is a version of the world. If you do not like it, ignore it; or offer your own version in return.
author: Salman Rushdie

quote: The only important thing in a book is the meaning that it has for you.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: The greatest part of a writer's time is spent in reading, in order to write; a man will turn over half a library to make one book.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: A good book has no ending.
author: R.D. Cumming

quote: A room without books is like a body without a soul.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Reading brings us unknown friends.
author: Honoré de Balzac

quote: Books are uniquely portable magic.
author: Stephen King

quote: When I get a little money, I buy books. If any is left, I buy food and clothes.
author: Erasmus

quote: Reading is an act of civilization; it’s one of the greatest acts of civilization because it takes the free raw material of the mind and builds castles of possibilities.
author: Ben Okri

quote: A book is the only place where you can examine a fragile thought without breaking it.
author: Edward P. Morgan

quote: A library is not a luxury but one of the necessities of life.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: The more you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you’ll go.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: Books are the quietest and most constant of friends; they are the most accessible and wisest of counselors, and the most patient of teachers.
author: Charles W. Eliot

quote: A book is a garden, an orchard, a storehouse, a party, a company by the way, a counselor, a multitude of counselors.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: Books are the treasured wealth of the world and the fit inheritance of generations and nations.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: To read without reflecting is like eating without digesting.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: You know you've read a good book when you turn the last page and feel a little as if you have lost a friend.
author: Paul Sweeney

quote: There is no friend as loyal as a book.
author: Ernest Hemingway
